verses.verse: Then came<WH935> David<WH1732> to Nob<WH5011> to Ahimelech<WH288> the priest<WH3548>: and Ahimelech<WH288> was afraid<WH2729> at the meeting<WH7125> of David<WH1732>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH376>, Why are you alone, and no man with you?

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto Ahimelech<WH288> the priest<WH3548>, The king<WH4428> has commanded<WH6680> me a business<WH1697>, and has said<WH559> unto me<WH376>, Let no man know<WH3045> any thing<WH3972> of the business<WH1697> whereabout I send<WH7971> you<WH6680>, and what I have commanded you<WH3045>: and I have appointed my servants<WH5288> to such<WH6423> and such<WH492> a place<WH4725>.
Now therefore what is<WH3426> under your hand<WH3027>? give<WH5414> me five<WH2568> loaves of bread<WH3899> in my hand<WH3027>, or what there is present<WH4672>.

And the priest<WH3548> answered<WH6030> David<WH1732>, and said<WH559>, There is no common<WH2455> bread<WH3899> under my hand<WH3027>, but there is<WH3426> hallowed<WH6944> bread<WH3899>; if the young men<WH5288> have kept<WH8104> themselves at least<WH389> from women<WH802>.

And David<WH1732> answered<WH6030> the priest<WH3548>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH518>, Of a truth women<WH802> have been kept<WH6113> from us about these three<WH8032> days<WH8543>, since I came out<WH3318>, and the vessels<WH3627> of the young men<WH5288> are holy<WH6944>, and the bread is in a manner<WH1870> common<WH2455>, Yes<WH6942>, though it were sanctified this day<WH3117> in the vessel<WH3627>.

So the priest<WH3548> gave<WH5414> him hallowed<WH6944> bread<WH3899>: for there was no bread there but the showbread<WH3899>, that was taken<WH5493> from before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068>, to put<WH7760> hot<WH2527> bread<WH3899> in the day<WH3117> when it was taken away<WH3947>.

Now a certain man<WH376> of the servants<WH5650> of Saul<WH7586> was there that day<WH3117>, detained<WH6113> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068>; and his name<WH8034> was Doeg<WH1673>, an Edomite<WH130>, the chiefest<WH47> of the herdsmen<WH7462> that belonged to Saul<WH7586>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto Ahimelech<WH288>, And is there<WH3426> not<WH371> here under your hand<WH3027> spear<WH2595> or sword<WH2719>? for I have neither brought<WH3947> my sword<WH2719> nor my weapons<WH3627> with me<WH3027>, because the king<WH4428>'s business<WH1697> required<WH1961> hurry<WH5169>.

And the priest<WH3548> said<WH559>, The sword<WH2719> of Goliath<WH1555> the Philistine<WH6430>, whom you slewest<WH5221> in the valley<WH6010> of Elah<WH425>, behold<WH3874>, it is here wrapped in a cloth<WH8071> behind<WH310> the ephod<WH646>: if you will take<WH3947> that<WH3947>, take it<WH312>: for there is no other save<WH2108> that here<WH2088>. And David<WH1732> said<WH559>, There is none like that<WH5414>; give it me.
And David<WH1732> arose<WH6965>, and fled<WH1272> that day<WH3117> for fear<WH6440> of Saul<WH7586>, and went<WH935> to Achish<WH397> the king<WH4428> of Gath<WH1661>.

And the servants<WH5650> of Achish<WH397> said<WH559> unto him<WH1732>, Is not this David the king<WH4428> of the land<WH776>? did they not sing<WH6030> one to another of him<WH2088> in dances<WH4246>, saying<WH559>, Saul<WH7586> has slain<WH5221> his thousands<WH505>, and David<WH1732> his ten thousands<WH7233>?
And David<WH1732> laid up<WH7760> these words<WH1697> in his heart<WH3824>, and was very<WH3966> afraid<WH3372> of<WH6440> Achish<WH397> the king<WH4428> of Gath<WH1661>.

And he changed<WH8138> his behavior<WH2940> before<WH5869> them<WH1984>, and feigned himself mad in their hands<WH3027>, and scrabbled<WH8427> on the doors<WH1817> of the gate<WH8179>, and let his spittle<WH7388> fall down<WH3381> upon his beard<WH2206>.
Then said<WH559> Achish<WH397> unto his servants<WH5650>, Behold<WH7200>, you see the man<WH376> is mad<WH7696>: why then have you brought him to me<WH935>?
Have I need<WH2638> of mad men<WH7696>, that you have brought<WH935> this fellow to play the mad man<WH7696> in my presence<WH935>? shall this fellow come into my house<WH1004>?
